result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

16CF7, 94, 95, 308, 401, 16CM121 Defendant Melissa M. Kotek in court, in custody with attorney Bradley J Jansen.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews charges and penalties, defendant pleads guilty to ct. 1 of 16CF7, ct 1 of 16CF94, ct 1 of 16CF95, ct 1 of 16CF308, ct 1 and 5 of 16CF401, court finds plea made FVKI, court accepts plea's and finds def guilty, remaining counts in all cases are DRI including 16CM121, character witnesses speak, victim heard, state heard, defense counsel heard, defendant heard, court heard and sentence imposed.  Cash bond shall be used to pay restitution.  Atty Jansen will provide a credit slip.

16CF94, 16 CF95, 16CM121, Defendant Melissa M. Kotek in court, in custody with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton.  Atty Jansen appears on the CM cases.  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Shelton heard, has conflict, judge sign withdrawal, Atty Jansen will be appointed on all of defendants cases.  Atty Shelton is excused.   Review of info is waived; not guilty plea entered; 30 days mtns; stc set; bail con't.  Atty Jansen heard as to bond motion, state heard, court reduces cash bail to $1000 total on all cases, conditions are the same.
The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.

(12:54) Defendant Melissa M. Kotek in custody via video with attorney Jaclyn R. Shelton (will appoint).  Gilbert Grant Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Def. stands mute; Court finds probable cause. Court enters Not Guilty plea. State requests $1,000 Cash bond; Court orders set to track w/16CF94 & 95 per Atty. Shelton's request; Court sets $1,000 CASH Bond with conditions:  The Jail shall permit Defendant to make a phone call at the county expense for bail purposes.
